This note is ambiguous for it is more probable that the word prabu appears before rama. But if it is the case, than it is misread since the manuscript undoubtedly contains the word prabu just before rama. rama rәsi disi mvaṅ tarahan,

ini pañcakusika, saṅ kusika, di gunuṅ, saṅ garga di rumbut, saṅ mestrimestiThis due to the problematic transciption of the character ṭā. In the Old West-Javanese manuscript corpus, this character can represent both ṭā or tra. In the case of mesṭi, I prefers to reconstruct it as mestri, since this is more common spelling in the Old Sundanese texts, i.e., Carita Parahyaṅan, Saṅ Hyaṅ Sasana Mahaguru, etc. Cf. Old Javanese metri. di mahameru, saṅ purusa di mandiri, saṅ patañjala di pañjulan.
